thread.title: Mark Richt 'optimistic' Nick Chubb injury won't require surgery
thread.title_full: Mark Richt 'optimistic' Nick Chubb injury won't require surgery - CBSSports.com

author: Jerry Hinnen
title: Mark Richt 'optimistic' Nick Chubb injury won't require surgery
text:
Nick Chubb's left knee injury may be far less serious than first feared if his coach's optimism proves correct.
Chubb's knee bent awkwardly following a sideline tackle on the first play from scrimmage in Georgia's eventual 38-31 loss to Tennessee , and several minutes later Chubb was carted off the field to the locker room in considerable pain . But Mark Richt said before halftime he thought Chubb would be "OK in the long run" and said following the loss Chubb may not even need surgery on what appeared to be a certain season-ender.
“He was in pain: physical and mental pain," Richt said. "He wanted to be able to finish out this game. He's put so much work into it. I really don't know for sure, but I'm optimistic that it won't require surgery or anything, but I can't say it for certain."
Video of Richt's comments from Fox 5 Atlanta's Cody Chafins :
Richt says he doesn't know for sure if Chubb injury will need surgery, says he is optimistic #UGA pic.twitter.com/5nXo6lI2BC 
— Cody Chaffins (@Cody_Fox5) October 10, 2015 Saturday was a miserable day for Georgia. But if Chubb returns to action at any point this season, it won't be nearly as miserable as first thought.
Nick Chubb was carted off after being injured on the game's first play. (USATSI) Topics: SEC , Georgia Bulldogs , NCAAF
